author: Peppier handicapped symbol gets support, but problems remain
title: Islanders' fans aren't warming up to new policy at Barclays Center
text:
Islanders' fans aren't warming up to new policy at Barclays Center FOXSports 21 hrs ago © NHLI via Getty Images UNIONDALE, NY - NOVEMBER 29: Kyle Okposo #21 of the New York Islanders throws a puck over the glass to Islanders fans before the game against the New Jersey Devils at Nassau Veterans Memorial Coliseum on November 29, 2014 in Uniondale, New York. The Islanders defeated the Devils 3-1. (Photo by Mike Stobe/NHLI via Getty Images) Fans interested in receiving a closer look at pre-game warmups for the New York Islanders' home contests better have the proper ticket in tow.
AdChoices The Islanders have altered an unwritten rule allowing fans to watch the festivities from as close to the ice as possible, regardless of the ticket in their hand.
This season, Barclays Center CEO Brett Yormark announced a plan for 91 ticket holders per night to have access to VIP areas and watch the warmups. The decision, according to Yormark, is "another great benefit of being an Islanders season ticket holder."
Message from @brettyormark to season ticket holders re: watching warm ups at the glass before face off. #Isles pic.twitter.com/hf6JhLsmYw
— IslesBlog (@IslesBlog) October 14, 2015
While presumably the No. 91 is in tribute to captain John Tavares, many fans have voiced their displeasure with the most recent turn of events since the team moved from the Nassau Veterans Memorial Coliseum in Uniondale, N.Y.
This whole #Isles season is going to be test of which battles to fight. Letting fans on the glass for warm-ups seems like should be one.
— Dan Saraceni (@cultureoflosing) October 15, 2015
The team initially altered the Subway-style goal horn in the preseason , prompting numerous fans to vent on social media. The original Fog horn blast was returned later in the week.
(h/t Islanders Point Blank )
